body:
**What happened**:
Used kube-up.sh to bring up a GCE cluster and then logged on to the master.
Run kubectl on the master, is hangs for a while (30 seconds) and then returns an error.

$ kubectl get nodes
Error from server (InternalError): an error on the server ("") has prevented the request from succeeding

**What you expected to happen**:
I expected to get the node list.
If I use one of the system account's kubeconfig files it works.

$ sudo kubectl --kubeconfig=/mnt/disks/master-pd/srv/kubernetes/kube-bootstrap/kubeconfig get nodes
NAME                           STATUS                     ROLES    AGE   VERSION
kubernetes-master              Ready,SchedulingDisabled   <none>   26m   v1.18.0-alpha.2.55+e41bb325c2453f-dirty
kubernetes-minion-group-jfk6   Ready                      <none>   26m   v1.18.0-alpha.2.55+e41bb325c2453f-dirty
kubernetes-minion-group-mqnp   Ready                      <none>   26m   v1.18.0-alpha.2.55+e41bb325c2453f-dirty
kubernetes-minion-group-x540   Ready                      <none>   26m   v1.18.0-alpha.2.55+e41bb325c2453f-dirty

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Bring up a GCE cluster from head, ssh to master and run "kubectl get nodes"

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"18+", GitVersion:"v1.18.0-alpha.2.55+e41bb325c2453f-dirty", GitCommit:"e41bb325c2453fc373826f5cd2b8d9b106038d2f", GitTreeState:"dirty", BuildDate:"2020-01-23T00:38:39Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"18+", GitVersion:"v1.18.0-alpha.2.55+e41bb325c2453f-dirty", GitCommit:"e41bb325c2453fc373826f5cd2b8d9b106038d2f", GitTreeState:"dirty", BuildDate:"2020-01-23T00:36:29Z", GoVersion:"go1.13.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: GCE
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): COS m_77
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.19.76
- Install tools: cluster/kube-up.sh
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

I believe this used to work based on talking to KAS on the insecure port using no authentication.
The insecure port is now turned off and we require authentication materials.
We should probably setup an admin account specifically for the master.

title: Kubectl not working on GCE master
